content.2: Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman:
content.3: If when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;
content.4: Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
content.5: He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.

content.16: None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
content.17: Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.
content.18: When the righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.
content.19: But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.
content.20: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways.
